p: Perhaps, a unique chemical composition of mustard seeds could also be a reason for its higher tolerance to the MPEO. Mustard belongs to oilseed crops; its seeds contain approx. 28% of fatty acids, but also 0.1%–1.1% of essential oil [ 27]. As was showed in the other laboratory experiment, seedlings of another oilseed species— Brassica napus were able to germinate in the presence of different essential oils more, as compared to the other non-oilseed species [ 5]. Indeed, this phenomenon requires more in-depth studies.
